intro: Lisianthius latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Its broad, lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stem. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
